localNetworkGateway.name: Name for the Local Network Gateway resource in Azure
localNetworkGateway.gatewayIpAddress: Public IP address of your on-premises VPN device (e.g., '203.0.113.10')
localNetworkGateway.addressSpace: Array of on-premises network CIDR blocks that will be accessible through the VPN (e.g., ['10.0.0.0/16', '172.16.0.0/12'])
localNetworkGateway.description: Human-readable description of the on-premises network

vpnConnection.name: Name for the VPN connection resource in Azure
vpnConnection.connectionType: Connection type - use 'IPsec' for site-to-site VPN
vpnConnection.sharedKey: Pre-shared key (PSK) for IPsec tunnel - must match the key configured on your on-premises VPN device. Use a strong, random string (recommended: 32+ characters)
vpnConnection.enableBgp: Set to true to enable BGP routing (requires BGP ASN configuration on both sides)
vpnConnection.usePolicyBasedTrafficSelectors: Set to true for policy-based VPN devices (older Cisco ASA, etc.)

ipsecPolicies.enabled: Set to true to use custom IPsec/IKE policies (required for some VPN devices)
ipsecPolicies.saLifeTimeSeconds: Security Association lifetime in seconds (default: 27000 = 7.5 hours)
ipsecPolicies.saDataSizeKilobytes: Security Association data size in KB (default: 102400000 = ~100GB)
ipsecPolicies.ipsecEncryption: IPsec encryption algorithm: AES256, AES192, AES128, GCMAES256, GCMAES192, GCMAES128
ipsecPolicies.ipsecIntegrity: IPsec integrity algorithm: SHA256, SHA1, GCMAES256, GCMAES192, GCMAES128
ipsecPolicies.ikeEncryption: IKE encryption algorithm: AES256, AES192, AES128, GCMAES256, GCMAES128
ipsecPolicies.ikeIntegrity: IKE integrity algorithm: SHA384, SHA256, SHA1, GCMAES256, GCMAES128
ipsecPolicies.dhGroup: Diffie-Hellman group: DHGroup24, DHGroup14, DHGroup2, ECP384, ECP256
ipsecPolicies.pfsGroup: Perfect Forward Secrecy group: PFS24, PFS14, PFS2, ECP384, ECP256, None

quickStart.step1: Replace <YOUR-ONPREM-PUBLIC-IP> with your on-premises VPN device's public IP address
quickStart.step2: Replace <YOUR-SHARED-KEY-HERE> with a strong pre-shared key (PSK) - save this securely!
quickStart.step3: Update addressSpace array with your actual on-premises network CIDR blocks
quickStart.step4: Run the deployment script - VPN connection will be created automatically if this file is configured
quickStart.step5: Configure your on-premises VPN device with the matching settings and Azure VPN Gateway public IP

exampleConfiguration.fortinet: For FortiGate: Use IKEv2, AES256-SHA256, DH Group 14, PFS enabled
exampleConfiguration.cisco: For Cisco ASA: May require usePolicyBasedTrafficSelectors=true
exampleConfiguration.paloAlto: For Palo Alto: Use IKEv2, AES256-SHA256, DH Group 14
exampleConfiguration.sonicwall: For SonicWall: Use IKEv2, AES256-SHA256, PFS Group 14
exampleConfiguration.pfsense: For pfSense: Use IKEv2, AES256-SHA256, DH Group 14, PFS Group 14

_comments.disabling: To disable VPN Connection creation, delete this file or rename it to onprem-connection-parameters.json.disabled
